thread.title: Child finds racist note in Wendy's kids meal
thread.title_full: Child finds racist note in Wendy's kids meal - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Child finds racist note in Wendy's kids meal
text:
ARVADA, CO (KDVR/CNN) - Two employees from a Wendy's restaurant were fired after the fast-food chain said they put a racist note on a playing card in a kids meal.
It wasn't the largest protest, but the people in attendance Tuesday were passionate about the matter - especially the mother of the child who received the card.
"I had to explain to my child what the N-word means, and she's never heard that term before," Manige Osowski said.
According to Wendy's, two employees wrote the racist remarks and put it in the pack of cards.
"My child is now aware of what racism is, and what that word means," Osowski said. "And it's because of this card."
"This is something that is not the culture of Wendy's," said Wendy's spokeswoman Candis Goins. "You know, we took this very seriously, and we immediately investigated and identified the two employees that were involved. They no longer work for Wendy's."
Once the employees were let go, Wendy's apologized to the family. Osowski said she was waiting for a formal apology from the fast-food chain.
"I don't accept the apology because I am fully aware of what racism is in this country," she said.
Copyright 2015 KDVR via CNN.
